thread.title: AEA future remains uncertain | Associations
thread.title_full: AEA future remains uncertain | Associations content from ATWOnline

author: Victoria Moores
title: AEA future remains uncertain | Associations
text:
The Association of European Airlines (AEA) has secured approval for its 2016 budget, although its future is still to be decided following several high-profile member airline exits.
AEA represents 24 European network airlines, but over the last year it has lost key members including airberlin , Alitalia , British Airways and Iberia .
At the same time, the heads of the five most influential European airline groups—Air France-KLM, easyJet, International Airlines Group (IAG), Lufthansa Group and Ryanair —have joined forces to lobby on European airline policy . While no name has officially been given to this grouping, it is tentatively known as Airlines for Europe (A4E), mirroring the US airline lobby group Airlines for America (A4A).
Putting this in context, A4E’s five members carry 420 million passengers a year, compared with AEA, which has 25 members that carry nearly 300 million passengers annually. For the purposes of European lobbying, A4E has fewer voices and represents more of the traveling public.
“AEA has always been in favor of a one-voice approach of the airlines towards policy makers and regulators. The [member airline] presidents therefore welcome the current initiative to create this voice. They have decided to closely monitor the discussions that are ongoing between several airlines,” AEA said in a statement, issued following its Oct. 16 presidents’ assembly in Antwerp.
“A decision about the future of the Association of European Airlines will be taken by the presidents in due time. In this context the presidents have decided to approve the budget 2016 of the Association so that AEA can continue to support the airlines’ interests.”
AEA’s member airlines comprise Adria Airways, Aegean Airlines, airBaltic, Air France, Air Malta, Austrian Airlines, Brussels Airlines, Cargolux, Croatia Airlines, DHL, Finnair, Icelandair, KLM, LOT Polish Airlines, Lufthansa, Luxair, Meridiana, SAS, Swiss, TAP Portugal, TAROM, TNT Airways, Turkish Airlines and Ukraine International Airlines.
